resources.string:
AroundMe is an AllJoyn(TM) sample application that detects other users nearby and provides various ways to interact with each other.


 To run this app, you must designate a contact whose information provides a "Profile" for identifying yourself to other users. 
 The information in the contact need not be accurate or real, it can be an "alias"

AroundMe is an AllJoyn(TM) sample application that detects other users nearby and provides various ways to interact with each other. 

 Before use, you need to establish a profile that represents this device (user) and you do that by selecting a Contact from your address book. 

 (Press Back key to exit or wait a few seconds)

To use this app, you need to first identify a contact that will be used as your identity.
 It does not have to really be you, it can be any contact. The name, number, photo etc. will be taken from the contact entry.

Accepted items will be available to the normal media viewers. 
 Rejected items will be deleted.
\n Set the cheeckbox to include users. Clear it to exclude them \n
\nTouch the icon for the type of media that you want to send to the user displayed above, and press the Send or Cancel button.

Temporary activity to set up test data 

 Also runs AllJoyn services (will move to a background Service eventually)
